books.author: Ibram X. Kendi
books.description: A primer for creating a more just and equitable society through identifying and opposing racism. Read by the author. 10 hours, 43 minutes unabridged.
books.title: HOW TO BE AN ANTIRACIST

books.author: John Bolton
books.description: The former national security advisor gives his account of the 17 months he spent working for President Trump. Read by Robert Petkoff. 20 hours, 52 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE ROOM WHERE IT HAPPENED

books.author: Michelle Alexander
books.description: A law professor on the “war on drugs” and its role in the disproportionate incarceration of Black men. Read by Karen Chilton. 16 hours, 57 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE NEW JIM CROW

books.author: Layla F Saad
books.description: Ways to understand and possibly counteract white privilege. Read by the author. 5 hours, 19 minutes unabridged.
books.title: ME AND WHITE SUPREMACY

books.author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
books.description: A meditation on race in America as well as a personal story, framed as a letter to the author's teenage son. Read by the author. 3 hours, 35 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BETWEEN THE WORLD AND ME

books.author: Ijeoma Oluo
books.description: A look at the contemporary racial landscape of the United States. Read by Bahni Turpin. 7 hours, 41 minutes unabridged.
books.title: SO YOU WANT TO TALK ABOUT RACE

books.author: Glennon Doyle
books.description: The activist and public speaker describes her journey of listening to her inner voice. Read by the author. 8 hours, 22 minutes unabridged.
books.title: UNTAMED

books.author: Michelle Obama
books.description: The former first lady describes her journey from the South Side of Chicago to the White House, and how she balanced work, family and her husband’s political ascent. Read by the author. 19 hours, 3 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BECOMING

books.author: Austin Channing Brown
books.description: A Black woman who was given a white man's name by her parents shares her journey to finding her own worth and what stands in the way of racial justice. Read by the author. 3 hours, 54 minutes unabridged.
books.title: I'M STILL HERE

books.author: Trevor Noah
books.description: A memoir about growing up in South Africa by the host of “The Daily Show.” Read by the author. 8 hours, 50 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BORN A CRIME

books.author: Ibram X Kendi
books.description: A look at anti-Black racist ideas and their effect on the course of American history. Read by Christopher Dontrell Piper. 19 hours, 8 minutes unabridged.
books.title: STAMPED FROM THE BEGINNING

books.author: Malcolm Gladwell
books.description: Famous examples of miscommunication serve as the backdrop to explain potential conflicts. Read by the author. 8 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.
books.title: TALKING TO STRANGERS

books.author: Bryan Stevenson
books.description: A civil rights lawyer and MacArthur grant recipient’s memoir of his decades of work to free innocent people condemned to death. Read by the author. 11 hours, 11 minutes unabridged.
books.title: JUST MERCY

books.author: Dinesh D'Souza
books.description: The conservative commentator makes his case that identity politics are woven into what he considers socialism in America. Read by the author. 10 hours, 4 minutes unabridged.
books.title: UNITED STATES OF SOCIALISM

books.author: Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.contributor: by Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.title: EXTREME OWNERSHIP

books.author: Jerry Craft
books.description: Jordan Banks, an artistically inclined seventh grader from Washington Heights, has a tough time navigating an upscale private school where diversity is low and maintaining his neighborhood friendships.
books.title: NEW KID

books.author: Nathan W Pyle
books.description: A sequel to “Strange Planet” that explores the subjects of traditions, nature, emotions and knowledge.
books.title: STRANGER PLANET

books.author: Raina Telgemeier
books.description: Raina finds her tummy trouble might be more than it first appears to be when she goes back to school.
books.title: GUTS

books.author: Kohei Horikoshi
books.description: The Meta Liberation Army prepares for a new metahuman revolution but Tomura plans to fight.
books.title: MY HERO ACADEMIA, VOL. 24

books.author: Terri Libenson
books.description: The fourth book in the Emmie & Friends series. A middle school girl goes outside her comfort zone.
books.title: BECOMING BRIANNA

books.author: Shannon Hale
books.contributor: by Shannon Hale. Illustrated by LeUyen Pham
books.description: Shannon struggles to keep up with what is considered cool.
books.title: BEST FRIENDS

books.description: A graphic novel version of the story about a class clown trying to distract herself from serious matters.
books.title: JACKY HA-HA

books.author: Raina Telgemeier
books.description: Raina is stuck in the back seat between her younger brother and sister for a weeklong road trip in this family memoir.
books.title: SISTERS

books.author: Kohei Horikoshi
books.description: In a world full of of people who can develop superpowers, Izuku Midoriya is just a “normal” teenager. Will a chance encounter with a superhero change his fate? Most likely!
books.title: MY HERO ACADEMIA, VOL. 1

books.author: Raina Telgemeier
books.description: Callie becomes the stage manager for her middle school’s production of "Moon Over Mississippi."
books.title: DRAMA

books.contributor: by Ann M. Martin. Illustrated by Katy Farina
books.description: Karen wants to prove her neighbor is a witch named Morbidda Destiny.
books.title: BABY-SITTERS LITTLE SISTER: KAREN'S WITCH

books.contributor: by FGTeeV. Illustrated by Miguel Díaz Rivas

books.title: FGTEEV PRESENTS: INTO THE GAME!

books.description: Raina experiences braces, boy troubles and other plagues of the sixth grade.
books.title: SMILE

books.description: Moments from the life cycle of a planet’s inhabitants including “Being Gains a Sibling” and “Being Begins a Vocation.”
books.title: STRANGE PLANET

books.description: As she starts a new school year, Natalie learns to focus on who she is rather than who she isn’t.
books.title: NAT ENOUGH

books.description: Painful childhood memories surface for Zoe Morgan when she has a child of her own.

books.description: Cullen Post, a lawyer and Episcopal minister, antagonizes some ruthless killers when he takes on a wrongful conviction case.
books.title: THE GUARDIANS

books.description: Jack Reacher gets caught up in a turf war between Ukrainian and Albanian gangs.
books.title: BLUE MOON

books.author: Lisa Jackson and Nancy Bush

books.title: LAST GIRL STANDING

books.author: Nicholas Sparks
books.description: Difficult choices surface when Hope Anderson and Tru Walls meet in a North Carolina seaside town.
books.title: EVERY BREATH

books.description: President Jonathan Duncan, a gulf war veteran and widower, takes on adversaries at home and abroad.

books.description: An editor receives an anonymous manuscript and sets out to discover its author’s identity.
books.title: ENVY

books.author: Sherryl Woods
books.description: When her husband leaves her for a younger woman, a mother of three children restarts her life and falls for her son’s baseball coach.

books.description: Caleb Rooney, a police detective and celebrity food truck chef, must clear his name of murder allegations.
